description: A Rock n' Roll Funk n' Soul Bartop Burlesque DANCEHALL-SALOON! CraftBeer & Special Cocktails. Nachos & more. LIVE MUSIC• DRAG•THEATRE•DJs•FUN OPEN 7days/week Burlesque shows & DJs in a cheeky saloon with a mahogany bar serving craft beer & clever nibbles.

reviews.title: Paranoid, Discrimatory, Freedom Hating
text: Requires that you surrender your Liberty  and submit to experimental medical procedures and pretend that healthy people are disease vectors. Clownworld in Operation. Avoid these brainwashed Freedom Hating idiots. It should be renamed the Paranoid Mass Delusional Psychosis Lady

reviews.title: Google Recommended so Popped in
text: Little Portugal is an area that was recommended by a couple of folks. Apparently it has quite a few bars and restaurants. (they’re right!) So googled what was popular within the area. The Painted Lady came up and it sounded like fun. (live music and burlesque are its specialties) After grabbing a bite elsewhere popped in to Painted Lady and had a couple of drinks. There was a $10 cover and what sounded like a rock band was on stage. They sounded really good. (not sure when burlesque occurs) Didn’t stay long, but this venue and the area seems to hosts Torontonians more than tourists. I appreciated that. It gave me, what felt like,  a more authentic experience. (as a tourist)

reviews.title: If you know what burlesque is, its not this..
text: Read the other reviews of people who ACTUALLY know what burlesque is... Because this is not burlesque. This is girls who take their clothes off on a bar top, and they are cranky when they get told such.

You can call your artform whatever you like, but if your missing the key elements of what makes a specific type of dance, a dance, don't degrade those who actually know how to do it with your poor interpretation. I was very disappointed this was misrepresentated.
However, the actual bar was decent and the servers were very nice.

reviews.title: Really
text: I read the last review.
You have to understand this is a good bar with good music / dancing with a little twist for some added fun.
If you're looking for a show where you sit in a seat and watch semi nude girls dance this is not it.
But if you're looking for a fun place with equal amounts of men and women there and some women dancing on the bar, this is it.
Hats off to this bar for coming up with an idea that did make the whole experience a little more fun.
We raised the average age as it is a young crowd but they were high five-ing us when we left after spending 1hr on the dance floor with them.
Fun friendly place and a good bar!
I say check it out but don't expect a typical theater show because that's not what this place is all about.

reviews.title: Service and music were terrific
text: Went in for some beers and the live band (Hunger or Hungry Lake) blew my mind. Amazing. It gets pretty full close to the stage, but there is a live cc above the bars where you can watch the band playing 15 m from where you sit.

Service was really attentive BUT this place only takes cash. There is an ATM in the basement in a dark creepy corner in the basement, FYI. Interested in going back for burlesque show they have on the weekends. Will absolutely go back. The talent in their band was incredible.

reviews.title: That was NOT burlesque!
text: This place is not somewhere to see burlesque dancing and they should just say it like it is-they have some mostly naked girls dancing on the bars a few inches away from your face.  We went in for burlesque, which we have seen many times.  The theatre of the seduction was 100% absent from this display, which consisted solely of the dancer writhing on the bar.  We left after one quick drink.

reviews.title: Open mike night shouldn’t be free!
text: We heard about this bar through some travelling friends we met the night before who were performing at the open mike night. The acts they had at this quaint, sweet little bar were all exceptionally talented and I would have happily have paid $5 to join the crowd! Great selection of alcoholic beverages and reasonable prices. Highly recommend visiting for a live music chill!

reviews.title: Great Little Bar
text: This is a great little bar with good local talent for live music, Really enjoyed it here. Good service with good selection of drinks - neat atmosphere. Mixed aged group which was nice.

reviews.title: Great entertainment, night after night
text: One of my favorite spots in Toronto. The Painted Lady offers really good live music during the week and fun DJs and bartop burlesque on weekends. The price is always right, and the staff there is fantastic. They also have some pretty tasty menu items when you get hungry including pulled pork!

reviews.title: The vibiest, most USA meets Europe, seriously sexy, fun, bar in all Canada. Period.
text: Been flying in and out of Toronto for years. And I've been to at least a thousand bars all over the world. My work takes me all over. And, I love bars, and this one is very special. The best places have an energy you can't deny, and The Painted Lady has it in spades. Bars like this are very few and far between. You just can't manufacture something like The Painted Lady. She's got an authenticity and feel like no other.

I asked how the place came to be, and a fellow patron piped up and told me about how the owners spent many years in New Orleans' pre-Katrina days, how their good friends were 'dancers' there, rock & movie stars, and famous writers and photographers, and how they traveled a bunch to other locales, yet were really down-to-earth... Forget the gal's name, but she must have been a regular. In any case, truly, you can feel there's something else going on here - it doesn't feel like any other bar in Toronto. Can't believe I've never been here before...

My co-worker had a Caesar, and she said it was one of the best she's ever had. I love wheat beer, so I was shocked to see Weihenstephaner on tap, but they had a selection of other great beers as well ranging from local craft brews to seldom seen Red Rider from the other side of Canada. Everything on tap was great and well-chosen. Solid place for drinking beer, if you LIKE beer. But the mixed drinks were exceptional as well. I chased my beers down with an 'Old Fashioned' that was made sooo right! I've had thousands of these and this was one was crazy good.

The music was great, one song after the next. The sound in this place was incredible - really! The bartenders were nice, attentive, and personable... The crowd was friendly, eclectic, loud, but fun - it was a Friday night! And the lovely lady dancing was mesmerizing. I'm a guy, but even my lady friend/co-worker loved her, and commented on how really what a great burlesque performer she was - how she really rode the fine line between sex and class.

We had a blast! Got out of our minds and skins, and had a night to remember! What a place! I love the Painted Lady! Got to be one of my favorite bars in Canada - what am I saying??? Probably one of my favorite bars in the world. She's apparently been going strong for 8 years, and I can understand why. She's got that special vibe man, that makes you feel so buzzed and warm inside. You know it from the moment you sit down at that beautiful wood bar. Classic place. I'll see you soon!

reviews.title: So-so
text: I am a lover of classic burlesque style (pearls, feathered boas.. Etc) so I was excited at first to visit The Painted Lady.

Until I got there I realized it wasn't as classy as I had hoped. I love when a women feels empowered to be sexual in a way without being too, strip show, and this was not a good representation of that. The dancer lacked tease and suspense. Overall, I think this establishment has potential. I would visit again to see if the other dancers are different, but until then I rank this place as so-so.

reviews.title: Absolute best time ever!!
text: I was looking for a place to go with some of my girlfriends to celebrate a birthday.  We are all in our 30's so we wanted a place that wasn't full of 20 somethings, was different then your average bar and you could dance your a%# off.  Well we found it at the painted lady.  Amazing dj, great atmosphere and non stop fun. You want good times this is the place to go!!

reviews.title: Had a fabulous time - great DJ, fun atmosphere and a burlesque dancer
text: We took some friends out for a night out in Toronto and hit up Ossington Ave as there is always something fun going on.
After dinner we stopped into The Painted Lady as I had read good review of it.
The DJ was just setting up and we noticed how excited the ladies were to see him - good sign!
The bartender was super friendly and we were able to run a tab, no problem. The scene is great when you are in your mid-30s. It is an older crowd - from mid 20s to late 30s. Loved it.

The music started and it brought everyone to the dance floor - and the crowd here loved to dance. In under twenty minutes was the first conga line! The DJ was super awesome, playing a mix of 80s and 90s dance hits. Then, right when you thought it couldn't be more fun a burlesque dancer hopped on top of the bar and started dancing. Small and intimate, this club is so so fun and I can't wait to go back.
Easy to get to as well, you can hop the Dundas street car and get off at Ossington.

reviews.title: A bar for an enertainment adventure
text: The Painted Lady is really original.  The first time we went there last year, we missed the entertainment (a rock band that night), but enjoyed a great beer selection and a nice chat with a friendly bar tender.  This time we went on a busy Saturday night in time for the entertainment and they had a geat dj playing eighties music and a burlesque dancer dancing on the bar!  We definitely have this on our our must see list because there is always something cool and different going on and the clientelle is a good mix.
